modules.description: This module implements RSA-PSS signature verification using SHA256 as the hash function and provides a function to compute SHA256 digests of input strings. It operates on strings for keys, data, and signatures, returning result types that indicate success or verification failure. It is suitable for validating cryptographic signatures in secure communication protocols or data integrity checks where RSA-PSS is required.

This module handles cryptographic operations including decoding private keys, generating RSA key pairs, extracting public keys from private keys, and signing data using PSS. It works with private key values of type `t`, timestamps, and string-encoded cryptographic data. Concrete use cases include loading and validating private keys, generating secure RSA keys, and producing digital signatures for authentication or integrity checks.

This module implements cryptographic verification operations using Mirage's crypto library. It works with wire-encoded data, cryptographic keys, and signatures to validate signed identifiers. It is used to verify the integrity and authenticity of resources in a trust-on-first-use (TOFU) security model, specifically by checking signatures against known keys and returning valid identifiers along with any verification errors.

This module implements RSA-PSS signature verification with SHA256, cryptographic verification for TOFU models, and cryptographic operations including key handling and signing. It works with strings, wire-encoded data, private and public keys, and timestamps. Use cases include validating signatures in secure communications, verifying signed identifiers in trust-on-first-use systems, and generating or using RSA keys for digital signatures.
